moves.1. e4: I haven't played chess at all in almost a year, so I already know this is going to be a tough match-up, but it's a tournament, and I don't control who I play against.
moves.1... g6 2. f4 b6 3. d4: It looks like we both have different kinds of pawn defenses in mind.
moves.3... Bb7 4. Nc3 Bg7: sometimes symmetry helps me with the board
moves.5. Be3 e6 6. Qd3 Ba6: Time to put myself into the offensive position.
moves.7. Qd2 d5 8. e5 c5 9. dxc5 Ne7: move my knight to e7 so that I have an advantage over his knight and queen if they were to take my pawn at d5.
moves.10. cxb6 axb6 11. Qf2 Nd7 12. Bb5: I saw his bishop the whole time, but was willing to trade bishops if it came down to it.
moves.12... Bxb5 13. Nxb5 O-O: Time to get my rook ready.
moves.14. Nf3 f6 15. exf6 Bxf6 16. h4 Bxb2: Time to take out as many pieces as I can and put myself in another offensive position.
moves.19. Bc1 Bxc1: So that we can trade bishops...
moves.20. Rfxc1: and make his second rook useless while waiting behind a pawn.
moves.20... Qb8: My plan for checkmate is starting to come in to focus.
moves.21... Nxe5: but I don't need that knight so I don't mind trading...
moves.22. fxe5 Qxe5: along with taking his pawn and keeping checkmate in sight.
moves.23. Qxb6: That was a mistake taking my pawn.  They just took their queen away from the defense I was worrying about.
moves.23... Rb8: Time to make a bold move
moves.24. Qc6: Trapping their queen behind one of my pawns, so they don't ruin my plan.
moves.24... Nxh4 25. Nc3: At this point, I'm planning on them taking my rook by his "knight."  I have checkmate in sights
moves.25... Qg3 26. Rxb8+: I never saw that coming, but I knew that I was going to have mate in one move anyway.
moves.26... Kg7 27. Qxe6: It puzzled me that they didn't try to put me in to check again because...
